0.title: Sidhu Moosewala's parents meet Home Minister Amit Shah in Chandigarh
0.article_body: Days after singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district, his parents met Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday in Chandigarh. Moosewala's father had written a letter to Shah, seeking an investigation by a central agency into his son's killing. Earlier, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann met Moosewala's parents in Moosa village.

1.title: Police stop Varanasi seer from going to Gyanvapi to offer prayers
1.article_body: The police on Saturday stopped Swami Avimukteshwaranand, a seer at Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, from going to the Gyanvapi complex to offer prayers. Following this, the seer said, "Until I'm not given permission to worship the Shivling in Gyanvapi, I won't eat anything." Earlier, the seer had claimed that he and 70 others will offer prayers at the 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi.

2.title: Vicky Kaushal's 'Sardar Udham' wins 3 IIFA technical awards
2.article_body: Vicky Kaushal-starrer 'Sardar Udham' won in three categories at the 2022 IIFA technical awards including best cinematography, best editing and best special effects (Visuals). 'Atrangi Re' starring Sara Ali Khan, Dhanush and Akshay Kumar won best choreography for 'Chaka Chak' and best background score for AR Rahman. 'Shershaah' which featured Sidharth Malhotra won the best screenplay award.

3.title: Words can't express how much you inspired me: Shirley Setia on KK
3.article_body: Singer Shirley Setia penned a note remembering singer KK who passed away on Tuesday evening. "Met you three times and every time I couldn't gather...courage to speak...with you...yet you...heard me, and always wished me well," Shirley wrote while sharing a picture with the late singer. "Words will not express how much you and your music have inspired me," she added.

4.title: It's great that Rahane, Ishant have been dropped from Test squad: Hogg
4.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said it is "great" that batter Ajinkya Rahane and pacer Ishant Sharma have been dropped from Team India's Test squad. "They have been ageing and haven't been performing of late," added Hogg. "You need to get the youth in and rotate them so that they get experience alongside those who are already experienced," stated Hogg.

5.title: Cycling in Pune 1 min slower than car drive over same distance: NGOs
5.article_body: After conducting an experiment, NGOs Save Pune Traffic Movement (SPTM) and Parisar have found that cycling in Pune is just 45 seconds to one minute slower than driving a car over a one-kilometre distance. The NGOs said the experiment demonstrated that bicycles are faster than cars when congestion is higher. More people can be encouraged to use bicycles, they added.

6.title: Fire breaks out at cargo bay of Delhi airport, no casualty reported
6.article_body: A fire broke out at the cargo bay of Delhi airport after a pushback towing vehicle reportedly caught fire at 5:25 pm on Friday. "Fire brigade immediately reached the location and controlled the fire," airport officials present there said. Though a video of the incident showed several passenger planes present at the spot, no casualties were reported.

7.title: Intelligence services in communication with captured fighters: Ukraine
7.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Minister Denys Monastyrskiy said the country's intelligence services are in communication with fighters captured at the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol. "It's through them [intelligence services] that we're learning about the conditions of the detention, nutrition and the possibility of their release," he added. In May, Russia said about 2,000 Mariupol fighters had surrendered.

8.title: She is my goddaughter: Anusha Dandekar on adoption rumours
8.article_body: After posting a picture with a baby writing, "I finally have a little girl I can call my own," Anusha Dandekar took to Instagram Stories to clarify that the baby is not adopted but her goddaughter. Anusha wrote in another story, "I am the God Mother...I vow to look after her...She's like a daughter to me...BUT NOT my real daughter."

9.title: KK was never mobbed at concert, AC was working: Police on 'mismanagement' claims
9.article_body: After several claims of 'mismanagement' of singer KK's concert emerged after his death, the Kolkata Police have said there was sufficient police presence at the venue. "At no point of time was he (KK) mobbed," said Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Goyal. He said there was never a situation where people were short of space and the air-conditioning was working.

10.title: Sheryl told people she felt burned out & had become a punching bag at Meta: Report
10.article_body: Sheryl Sandberg recently stepped down as Meta's COO after 14 years at the company. According to a report, Sheryl had been talking to people about how she "felt burned out" and that she increasingly felt "like a punching bag" for the company's problems. She sees herself as someone who has been targeted, said a person who worked with her.

11.title: Uma Thurman to play US President in 'Red, White & Royal Blue'
11.article_body: Uma Thurman has signed on to star in Prime Video's upcoming film 'Red, White & Royal Blue'. The actress will portray US President Ellen Claremont in the romantic-comedy. The film is based on the novel of the same name by Casey McQuiston, reported Deadline. Directed by Matthew Lopez, the film also features Nicholas Galitzine and Taylor Zakhar Perez.

12.title: 'Heeramandi' to be made on a budget of ₹200 cr, Bhansali to get ₹65 cr: Report
12.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali's web series 'Heeramandi' will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore. "Bhansali will be pocketing around ₹60-65 crore rupees as directorial fee, the rest of the 200-crore budget for 'Heeramandi' goes into production costs and in paying...actors," a source told Bollywood Hungama. It'll reportedly feature Sonakshi Sinha, Manisha Koirala, Huma Qureshi and Richa Chadha.

13.title: UEFA apologises to fans for 'distressing events' at Champions League final
13.article_body: UEFA has issued an apology to the fans for the chaos due to the alleged ticket fraud at the Champions League final last week in Paris. "UEFA wishes to sincerely apologise to all spectators who had to experience...distressing events in the build-up to the UEFA Champions League final. No football fan should be put in that situation," UEFA said.

14.title: Boosting Delhi's groundwater level to ensure 24×7 supply to all: CM
14.article_body: After inspecting the Rohini sewage treatment plant, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the AAP government is working on increasing production capacity by recharging groundwater to provide 24×7 water supply to all houses in the city. He added that the government is working on a unique mix of natural and scientific methods to prevent sewage from flowing into river Yamuna.

15.title: Take pre-emptive action to control COVID: Union Health Secretary to Maha
15.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan wrote to Maharashtra's Additional Chief Secretary Dr Pradeep Vyas to take pre-emptive action to control the spread of COVID-19 in the state. He has asked the state to follow test, track, treat, vaccination and COVID-19 appropriate behaviour strategy. The weekly COVID cases rose in 6 districts, including Mumbai, Mumbai Suburban, Pune, Thane, Raigad and Palghar.

16.title: Body spray Layer'r Shot's ads accused of promoting rape, gets notice
16.article_body: Responding to outrage over an advertisement by Layer'r Shot, Advertising Standards Council of India said the ad is in "serious breach" of their code and against public interest. Layer'r was criticised over two advertisements. Both videos feature a group of men and a woman, wherein the men talk about taking a "shot". Several viewers accused the ads of promoting rape.

17.title: Losing musicians is very cruel: Rahman on KK, Lata Mangeshkar's death
17.article_body: AR Rahman, while speaking to media at IIFA Awards in Abu Dhabi, spoke about the musicians who passed away recently. "Losing musicians is very...cruel because every time they take you to another space," he said, adding, "I'm really...sad about losing Lata (Mangeshkar) ji, KK and SP Balasubrahmanyam. The list goes on but I think...world is societal, it keeps going on."

18.title: 2 killed, 3 injured after bus hits car on highway in UP's Gonda
18.article_body: Two people died while three got injured after a car collided with a bus on a highway in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda on Saturday. The two deceased, identified as Chand Babu (30) and Khuddan (58), were travelling in the car while the three injured were bus passengers, police said. Notably, the injured have been sent to Balrampur district hospital.

19.title: Their families are 'poor' in values, not 'influential': Mahindra on Hyd gangrape accused
19.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared an article about the recent gangrape of a minor in Hyderabad which reported the accused are from "influential families". Mahindra said, "I don't know these boys but may I suggest that the headline is inappropriate? These boys are not from 'influential' families but from 'poor' families. Families that are 'poor' in culture, upbringing and human values."

20.title: New York passes 'right to repair' bill for electronics, first US state to do so
20.article_body: The New York state legislature has passed the 'right to repair' bill covering electronics, becoming the first state in the US to do so. The 'Digital Fair Repair Act' requires manufacturers of digital electronic products to make tools, parts, and instructions for repair available to consumers and independent shops. The measure will take effect one year after it becomes law.

21.title: Plogging drive held in Pune ahead of Plogathon 2022; pics surface
21.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Saturday shared pictures from a plogging drive organised by the Radio Mirchi team at Pune's Porwal Road. The drive was conducted ahead of the 'Pune Plogathon 2022: Mega Drive' which will be held on June 5. Plogging is defined as a "combination of jogging and picking up litter", according to the PMC.

22.title: Woman injured after IPS officer creates ruckus at birthday party in Delhi
22.article_body: A woman suffered injuries after an IPS officer posted in Delhi created ruckus at birthday party hosted by a businessman at a cafe and bar in Kailash Colony on Friday. His friends reportedly tried to stop him, but he started throwing glasses, one of which hit the woman standing near him. She was rushed to Max hospital where she's recuperating.

23.title: Person booked for wheeling in Bengaluru; traffic police share video
23.article_body: A case was registered against a person and his two-wheeler was confiscated after he was seen wheeling on the road in Bengaluru, according to the city's DCP Traffic East. The traffic police also shared a video of the incident on their Twitter handle. "If you are wheeling, we are waiting to book (a) case against you," the traffic police said.

24.title: Victims won't be forgotten: US on China's Tiananmen Square anniversary
24.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said the efforts of the victims of China's crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators in Beijing's Tiananmen Square 33 years ago will "never be forgotten". China hasn't revealed how many people were killed when the army used live ammunition to clear Tiananmen Square protesters. China bans any public commemoration of the June 4 event on the mainland.

25.title: Banks willing to finance Reliance-Apollo bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
25.article_body: Lending banks are reportedly willing to finance a joint bid by Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management in case they acquire UK pharmacy chain Boots. Currently, the drugstore chain is owned by Walgreens Boots Alliance. Walgreens put up Boots for sale in December last year and has been seeking a valuation of about £7 billion for it.

26.title: Four onion traders die after being hit by unidentified vehicle in Karnataka
26.article_body: An unidentified vehicle killed four onion traders and injured one while they were changing their truck's tyre on National Highway-218 in Karnataka's Bagalkote. The deceased, identified as Malleshi Shankrappa Malali (42), Ramaswamy Mahadevappa Karigar (36), Razak Tamboli (54) and Nasir Mulla (42), were going to Bengaluru to sell onions, police said. Notably, the accused is still absconding.

27.title: Man rapes 9-year-old girl at factory in Northeast Delhi; arrested
27.article_body: A 46-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a nine-year-old girl inside a factory in the New Seelampur area of Northeast Delhi. According to police, the accused, who was known to the girl, lured her while she was playing on the street and raped her in the factory where he works. The girl is reportedly suffering from mental health disorders.

28.title: Hyderabad police make 3rd arrest in 17-yr-old girl's gang-rape case
28.article_body: Hyderabad police have arrested the third accused in connection with the gang-rape of a 17-year-old girl. The girl was gang-raped in a car by five persons she met at a party. Three persons have been arrested in the case, out of which two are juveniles, police said. They are being produced before juvenile court, police added.

29.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' becomes third-biggest Bollywood opener of 2022
29.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' has received the third-biggest opening of the year for a Bollywood film, as per a tweet by Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh. It has earned ₹10.7 crore on the first day of its release. Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' received the biggest opening, earning ₹14.11 crore, followed by 'Bachchhan Pandey', which earned ₹13.25 crore.

30.title: Rahul is at his best in T20s, captaincy will fire him up further: Shastri
30.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said opener KL Rahul is at his "very best" in T20 cricket, adding Rahul will be fired up even more after being named India's captain for the upcoming T20I series against South Africa. "Over the last two or three years, he has been one of the most consistent players in this format," stated Shastri.

31.title: Hizbul commander killed in encounter in J&K, 3 soldiers injured
31.article_body: A self-styled commander belonging to Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit was reportedly killed in an overnight encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, police said on Saturday. Incriminating materials, arms and ammunition including one AK-47 rifle have been recovered from him. Three soldiers and one civilian were also injured in the encounter. They were airlifted to an army hospital in Srinagar.

32.title: US' Ohio to let teachers carry guns after 24 hours of training
32.article_body: Governor of US' Ohio state Mike DeWine said that he'll sign a bill into law that will allow teachers and staff to carry guns in schools after completing up to 24 hours of initial training. The bill, which passed the Ohio General Assembly this week, was finalised ten days after a gunman killed 19 children at a Texas elementary school.

33.title: I prefer to lose French Open final and get a new foot: Rafael Nadal
33.article_body: After reaching his 14th French Open final, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said, "I prefer to lose the final and get a new foot that allows me to be happier in my day-to-day life." "Winning is nice and fills you with momentary joy. But life goes on," added Nadal, who is suffering from a chronic foot injury.

34.title: Take action by rising above religion, caste: Mayawati over Kanpur violence
34.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday, while reacting to the violence in Kanpur, urged the UP government to take action "by rising above religion, caste and party politics". "Government has to understand that in...absence of law and order, how investment and development are possible in the state?" Mayawati tweeted. Notably, three people including a police officer were injured in the violence.

35.title: Masks must in closed public spaces: Maharashtra health department's Add'l Chief Secy
35.article_body: Wearing masks has been made mandatory in closed public spaces in Maharashtra, as per a letter by the state Public Health Department Additional Chief Secretary Pradeep Vyas to district authorities. Masks will now be a must in public spaces like buses, cinemas and schools, Vyas said. This comes as Maharashtra reported over 1,000 daily cases for the past three days.

36.title: Gujarat Congress leader whose wife caught him with woman takes break from politics
36.article_body: After his wife caught him with a woman, ex-Union minister and Gujarat Congress leader Bharatsinh Solanki announced that he would be taking a break from politics for a few months. "We have not lived together for many years," the Congress leader said about his wife. He added that his wife had even contacted an exorcist to take his life.

37.title: Railways officer, 2 others held in bribery case by CBI in Lucknow
37.article_body: An officer in the Lucknow division of the Northern Railways was arrested by the CBI for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹80,000. The Deputy Chief Materials Manager (carriage and wagons) Alok Mishra was arrested along with two other people, identified as Avanish Mishra and Manjit Singh, CBI said. Also, unidentified public servants and private persons have been booked too.

38.title: Didn't want to look into a mirror: Masaba recalls struggle with acne
38.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta revealed that she suffered from acne when she was 12 years old. "What would you tell a 12-year-old who didn't want to look into...mirror for years...Thanks to acne blowing up on her face overnight...But she survived it all," she said. Masaba further said her mother, Neena Gupta, helped her overcome the difficult phase of her life.

39.title: Salman shares teaser of SRK's 'Jawan', says 'Mera jawaan bhai ready hai'
39.article_body: Salman Khan took to Instagram to share the teaser of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan'. "Mere jawaan bhai ready hai @iamsrk," he captioned the post. The film will be directed by Atlee, who has previously helmed films like 'Bigil' and 'Mersal'. 'Jawan' is slated to release in June 2023, in multiple languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

40.title: Facing Nadal in French Open final is an impossible task: Casper Ruud
40.article_body: Discussing his upcoming French Open 2022 final against Rafael Nadal, Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said facing Nadal in a French Open final sounds like an "impossible" task. "[Playing] Rafa in a Roland Garros final is...the greatest challenge there is in this sport...He's 13-0 in the finals," added Ruud. "I will need to play my best tennis ever," stated Ruud.

41.title: Cameras with face recognition feature installed at Gurugram's MG Road Station
41.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) has installed eight cameras with face recognition technology at the entry and exit gates of MG Road Metro Station in Gurugram. The cameras will be used for general surveillance and for tracing people, a GMDA official said. Currently, 1,130 CCTV cameras are operational at 212 junction locations in the city.

42.title: Man's head smashed with bricks, stabbed to death by 2 brothers in broad daylight in Delhi
42.article_body: Two brothers allegedly stabbed and beat a 28-year-old man to death in broad daylight after the latter demanded money from one of them for drugs in Delhi on Friday, police said. CCTV footage of the incident purportedly shows the deceased's head being smashed with bricks. One of the accused has been arrested, while the other is absconding, police added.

43.title: Goa govt launches 'Beach Vigil App' to report violations along beaches
43.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Friday launched 'Beach Vigil App' to report violations along the state's beaches directly to the tourism department. The app will allow users to report violations like drinking on the beach, unattended litter and other illegal services. In the first phase, the app will open for tourism department officials, Drishti workers, police and other stakeholders.

44.title: BigBasket gets ₹350 cr from holding company: Filings
44.article_body: Grocery delivery unicorn BigBasket has received ₹350 crore from holding company Supermarket Grocery Supplies, filings from business intelligence platform Tofler showed. This latest investment was approved on May 24. BigBasket had received ₹1,000 crore from its holding company, ET had reported in April. The investment comes months after BigBasket acquired Kerala-based startup Agrima Infotech.

45.title: Mexican city limits water access to 6 hours a day amid drought
45.article_body: A city in Mexico's Nuevo Leon state is limiting daily water access to residents to just a six-hour window amid historic drought in the region, authorities said. Monterrey city, which is home to 5.3 million people, will allow water use from 4 am to 10 am daily. The earlier policy restricted water to one day per week based on location.

46.title: Woman testifies US comedian Bill Cosby forcibly kissed her in his trailer when she was 14
46.article_body: During a civil trial against US comedian Bill Cosby, a woman testified that Cosby forcibly kissed her after inviting her into his trailer in Los Angeles in 1975 when she was 14. "He started kissing me...all over my face...tongue down my throat," she said. She claimed he led her into his trailer to help him fix his bow tie.

47.title: I thought it would never land: Ashwin on India's flight from Melbourne to Sydney in 2021
47.article_body: Recalling Team India's flight from Melbourne to Sydney during their 2020-21 tour, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "We were flying to Sydney and the flight encountered a thunderstorm." He added, "It was so scary that for a moment, I thought the flight would never land." Ashwin had even tweeted about the incident in 2021, writing, “Yours Turbulently, Melbourne to Sydney! #ouch #scary."

48.title: Hyderabad's Nampally railway station gets EV charging facility
48.article_body: An electric vehicle (EV) charging facility has been set up at the Nampally railway station in Hyderabad. The facility falls under a contract awarded by the Secunderabad Railway Division to set up EV charging facilities at 32 stations within its limits. The initiative will not only provide an important passenger amenity but also generate revenue for railways, an official said.

49.title: Have a super bad feeling about economy: World's richest man Elon Musk
49.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in an email titled "pause all hiring worldwide" for his employees, reportedly wrote that he has a "super bad feeling" about the economy. He added that Tesla would need to cut about 10% of the salaried staff. After the report about his email emerged, the company's shares fell 9% on Friday.

50.title: My ankle injury is very serious, very difficult moment for me: Zverev
50.article_body: Talking about his ankle injury during his French Open 2022 semi-final against Rafael Nadal which resulted in him being taken off the court in a wheelchair, world number three Alexander Zverev said his injury is "very serious". "Very difficult moment for me today on the court," added Zverev. Zverev retired in the middle of the match's second set.

51.title: Honey Singh bows down at AR Rahman's feet during IIFA Awards; video viral
51.article_body: A video showing rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh bowing down at AR Rahman's feet during IIFA Awards in Abu Dhabi has gone viral on social media. In the video, Honey can be seen singing on the stage before he walks up to Rahman and bows down at his feet. "Moment of my life with AR Rahman sir," Honey said.

52.title: I shared my heartbreaks with mom, she was non-judgmental: Mohnish on Nutan
52.article_body: Actor Mohnish Bahl, remembering his late actress-mother Nutan on her 86th birth anniversary, said that she was non-judgmental. "All the pains and tribulations of a teenager's love life, all the heartbreaks I shared with her," he added. "'Time moves on, things pass. Life doesn't end at any point' would be her kind advice," Mohnish further said.

53.title: A Manimekhalai appointed as 1st woman MD & CEO of Union Bank of India
53.article_body: The Centre has appointed A Manimekhalai as the MD and CEO of Union Bank of India for a period of three years with effect from the date of assumption of office. Notably, Manimekhalai will be the first woman to hold these positions at the bank. She will replace Rajkiran Rai G, who held these positions since 2017.

54.title: 178 women workers fall ill after gas leak at chemical plant in Visakhapatnam
54.article_body: At least 178 women fell sick after inhaling poisonous gas following a gas leak at the laboratory of a chemical plant in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam on Friday. They complained of stomach pain, burning sensation in their eyes and nausea and were shifted to different hospitals. Officials are yet to confirm the name of the leaked gas and its source.

55.title: Crypto consumers lost over $1 bn in scams since Jan 2021: US FTC
55.article_body: The US FTC has said cryptocurrency consumers have reported losing over $1 billion in scams since January 2021. Nearly half the people said the scam started with an ad, post or a message on social media. The average reported loss for an individual was $2,600. The top three cryptocurrencies used by consumers to pay scammers were Bitcoin, Tether and Ether.

56.title: Man hacked to death in crowded market in Punjab; act caught on CCTV
56.article_body: A case has been registered after a 25-year-old man was hacked to death by six unidentified persons in full public view at a crowded market in Punjab's Moga on Friday. CCTV footage of the incident purportedly shows the deceased trying to defend himself with a sword that he was carrying. "[The deceased] neck was cut open," a police official said.

57.title: I've deleted the show from my life: Sadh on participating in Bigg Boss 1
57.article_body: Amit Sadh spoke about participating in 'Bigg Boss 1' and said, "I thought it'll be...about physical strength." He added he got bored after a week as "people just gossiped there". Amit further said he doesn't remember much about his stay in 'Bigg Boss' house, adding, "I said the day...I'll come out...I'll delete this show from my life, I did that!"

58.title: 85-yr-old woman dies after being robbed, attacked on head in Pune
58.article_body: An 85-year-old woman died after being robbed and attacked by an unidentified assailant at Moi village in Khed taluka of Pune district. The deceased, identified as Tanabai Yelwande, was allegedly attacked on her head by the accused and was robbed of her gold ornament when the former was out on her morning walk, police said.

59.title: Hardik showed faith in all those players whom nobody believed in: Saha
59.article_body: GT wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha said his team's captain Hardik Pandya showed faith in all those players whom "nobody" believed in. "He provided me with a stage to prove myself. [I can] never forget his contribution," added Saha. "[Hardik] has gone through a sea change. He used to be restless earlier but has changed completely now," stated Saha.

60.title: Not certain which player will get chances in future: Harbhajan on Rohit, Kohli
60.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, Harbhajan Singh said, "With the next generation coming up, it can't be said for certain which player will get opportunities." "They did not have a good IPL 2022. They will be hoping that they lead...[India] to a win in...T20 World Cup 2022," added Harbhajan. Rohit failed to hit a fifty in IPL 2022.

61.title: Shaan pays tribute to KK by singing 'Pal' at a concert, shares video
61.article_body: Singer Shaan paid tribute to late singer KK by singing his song 'Pal' at a concert. Sharing a video on Instagram, Shaan wrote, "Remembering Kakes...Don’t know why but that’s what [I] call him...Kakes." "Seeing the pictures in the background and the song it's too touchy...Really, it's hard to believe he is no more," a fan commented on the video.

62.title: 2 killed, 7 injured after mosque collapses during Friday prayer in UP
62.article_body: Two persons were killed and seven others were injured after the roof of an old mosque reportedly collapsed while they were offering prayers on Friday at Juda village in Uttar Pradesh. While 45-year-old Mulim Khan died on the spot, Ishad aged 32, succumbed to injuries later during treatment. Others trapped in the debris were rescued and rushed to the hospital.

63.title: RBI likely to go for another 0.40% rate hike in next policy review meet: Report
63.article_body: The RBI is expected to go for another rate hike of 0.40% at the review of the monetary policy next week, as per a report. The RBI panel will reportedly follow it up with a 0.35% hike in rates in the August review or it may opt for a 0.50% hike next week and a 0.25% increase in August.

64.title: 2 Reuters journalists injured, driver killed in eastern Ukraine
64.article_body: Reuters said two of its journalists were injured on Friday when the car they were travelling in came under fire in eastern Ukraine. The driver of the vehicle was killed. The attack occurred when "photographer Alexander Ermochenko and cameraman Pavel Klimov were travelling in a car provided by Russia-backed forces on...Russian-held part of the road between Sievierodonetsk and...Rubizhne", it added.

65.title: 36 arrested over violence after BJP leader's remarks on Prophet in UP
65.article_body: As many as 36 people were arrested and three FIRs were filed after violence broke out in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, officials said on Saturday. The incident occurred following BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. "Action under Gangster Act will be taken against conspirators and their property will be...seized or demolished," Kanpur Nagar Police Commissioner said.

66.title: Nehra would come specially to get me to bowl in the nets separately: Dayal
66.article_body: GT pacer Yash Dayal termed his team's head coach Ashish Nehra as a "blessing" and a "fatherly figure", adding that Nehra would come specially to get him to bowl in the nets separately. "When other people used to see me and him talk, they used to say that Ashish [sir] sees himself in me when he was young," stated Dayal.

67.title: Mamata inaugurated railway bridge without inviting Railways Minister: BJP MLA
67.article_body: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday inaugurated a railway bridge in Hooghly, BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari criticised the move claiming that she hadn't invited Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw or any railway authorities. Eastern Railway had spent "lion's share" for the bridge, he alleged. Earlier, Eastern Railway wrote to the state government about not being informed about the event.

68.title: Drug peddler arrested with 8 kg ganja worth ₹1.6 lakh in Hyderabad
68.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police arrested a drug peddler and seized 8 kg of ganja worth ₹1.6 lakh from his possession. According to police, the accused had previously been involved in over 25 offences and was released from jail last month. He used to buy the narcotic substance in Andhra Pradesh and sold it to needy customers in Hyderabad, police added.

69.title: Mexican megachurch leader pleads guilty to sexually abusing 3 girls
69.article_body: The leader of a Mexican megachurch being held in US has pleaded guilty to sexually abusing three children. Naasón García pleaded guilty to two counts of forcible oral copulation involving minors and one count of a lewd act upon a child aged 15. California state prosecutors said he'd also wielded his spiritual influence to have sex with many female followers.

70.title: It was a turning point for TVF: Jitendra on mimicking Kejriwal in spoof
70.article_body: Actor Jitendra Kumar spoke about mimicking Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in a TVF spoof and said it turned out to be the turning point for TVF. "After...[its] success, we got a lot of brand integration and...could eventually make Permanent Roommates," he added. "The video also reached him (Kejriwal) and he called...us to shoot another one with him," Jitendra further said.

71.title: Earlier, we used to hear about underworld in Mumbai, it has started in Punjab now: Mika
71.article_body: Talking about Sidhu Moosewala's murder, singer Mika said, "Earlier, we used to hear about the underworld in Mumbai, and now that underworld has started in Punjab, which is a very wrong message." He added that celebrities will stop coming to Punjab for shooting and shows. He further said that even singers Gippy Grewal and Mankirt Aulakh have got death threats.

72.title: Take care of your back during honeymoon, we have a WC ahead: Sister to Deepak Chahar
72.article_body: India fast bowler Deepak Chahar's sister Malti took to Instagram to share a picture from Deepak's wedding with Jaya Bhardwaj. "Ab ladki hui humari...Wish you guys a very happy married life...@deepak_chahar9 please take care of your back during your honeymoon...we have World Cup ahead," she wrote. Deepak missed the entire IPL 2022 due to a back injury.

73.title: This will reduce population of Hindus: BJP leader on 24-yr-old's plan to marry herself
73.article_body: Commenting on 24-year-old Kshama Bindu's decision to marry herself on June 11 at Vadodara's Harihareshwar temple, BJP leader Sunita Shukla said, "She'll not be allowed to marry herself in any temple. Such marriages are against Hinduism." "This will reduce the population of Hindus," Shukla further said. Bindu had said, "I had this idea in my mind for a long."

74.title: Restaurants free to raise prices but service charge is consumer's choice: Goyal
74.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal while speaking about the issue of service charges by hotels said that it is a "consumer's choice". He added, "Restaurants can charge whatever they want, there's no price control from the government's side...We've...said that restaurants cannot charge service charges on the bill...If...more benefits are to be given to employees, it cannot be forced on customers."

75.title: I don’t follow the records, the records follow me: Cristiano Ronaldo
75.article_body: Having recently broken the world record for scoring most goals in football history as claimed by his club Manchester United, Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I don't follow the records but the records follow me." "It's...my motivation to...[keep] working hard...and my teammates help me all the way so I have to appreciate all the people who help Cristiano," added the footballer.

76.title: Delhi govt does less work, more publicity: MoS Education Annapurna Devi
76.article_body: Minister of State for Education Annapurna Devi accused Delhi government of doing less work and more publicity in the education sector. "Instead of running...for votes, you should focus on providing quality education," she said. Her comments came after Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia said the National Achievement Survey (NAS) must not turn into a high-stakes exam.

77.title: Putin made historic error by invading Ukraine: French Prez Macron
77.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday said that his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin had committed a "historic and fundamental error" by invading Ukraine. "I think he isolated himself,"  Macron added. However, the French President further said that Russia should not be "humiliated... so that the day the fighting stops, we can pave a way out through diplomatic means".

78.title: 22-yr-old woman arrested for killing partner in Greater Noida
78.article_body: A 22-year-old woman was held for allegedly murdering her 27-year-old partner by poisoning the latter and assaulting him to death in Greater Noida. The accused, identified as Rinki, allegedly committed the crime along with her brother and other suspects near Dadri on May 23, police said. The deceased, Gaurav Kumar, was assaulted after being fed poisonous food by Rinki.

79.title: 2nd arrest made by Hyderabad police in 17-yr-old girl's gang-rape case
79.article_body: Hyderabad police have made second arrest in 17-year-old girl's gang-rape case. The girl who went to a pub for a party was gang-raped inside a car. Earlier, West Zone DCP Joel Davis said that three of the five culprits who were identified are minors. One of the accused is a VIP's son, Davis had said.

80.title: India reports 3,962 new COVID-19 cases, 2,697 recoveries in last 24 hours
80.article_body: India has reported 3,962 COVID-19 cases, 2,697 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,041 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 22,416, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,677, according to the latest data.

81.title: Who is Satyendra Nath Bose, Indian physicist honoured by Google today?
81.article_body: Google on Saturday honoured the renowned Indian mathematician and physicist Satyendra Nath Bose with a doodle. On June 4, 1924, Bose sent his quantum formulations to Albert Einstein, who immediately recognised it as a significant discovery. His theoretical paper became one of the most important findings in quantum theory. Born in 1894, Bose was awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 1954.

82.title: Keep standby ambulance with doctor: Kolkata Police to event organisers
82.article_body: Kolkata Police have issued an advisory after Bollywood singer KK passed away soon after performing at a live concert and said, the event organisers must have an ambulance with a doctor outside the venue to ensure immediate medical assistance if needed. Excess entry passes must not be issued and police should be informed about the expected gathering beforehand, police said.

83.title: Twitter users compare SRK's look in 'Jawan' to Liam Neeson's in 'Darkman'
83.article_body: After Shah Rukh Khan shared the teaser of his upcoming film 'Jawan', several people on Twitter compared his look to Liam Neeson's bandaged look in the 1990 superhero film 'Darkman'. "Shah Rukh Ji...Haven't you seen Darkman 1990 Hollywood movie? Neeson getup," a user wrote, while another user wrote, "This is 100% 'inspired' by Sam Raimi's (director) underrated gem Darkman."

84.title: Who are we to say anything to Arjun when he has the great Sachin as his father: Kapil Dev
84.article_body: On being asked about Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar not featuring in MI's playing XI in IPL 2022, Kapil Dev said, "Why's everyone talking about him? Let him play his own cricket and don't compare with Sachin." He added, "Don't put pressure on Arjun...Who are we to say anything to him when he has the great Sachin as his father?"

85.title: Witness declared dead by CBI in journalist's murder case appears in Bihar court
85.article_body: A witness in the journalist Rajdeo Ranjan's murder case who was declared dead by CBI presented herself before the Muzaffarpur court on Friday. The court issued a show cause to CBI for submitting a false death report and directed it to submit its reply before June 20. Ranjan was shot dead in 2016 by a group of five men.

86.title: FIFA ban on India will be catastrophic not just for whole India but also for me: Chhetri
86.article_body: Talking about a possible FIFA ban on India after the Supreme Court put a team of administrators in charge of AIFF, Sunil Chhetri said, "That will be catastrophic, not just for the whole country but for me, because I'm 37." "I am playing my last games. You never know when there's a last game for you," he added.

87.title: 74 people injured as train collides with locomotive in Slovakia
87.article_body: At least 74 people were injured on Friday after a passenger train stopped due to a defect was hit by a locomotive that was coming to its aid in Slovakia. Of those wounded, four have sustained severe injuries and 34 people have been hospitalised, police said. There were around 100 people on the train at the time of the crash.

88.title: 24-yr-old claims she cracked UPSC in 1st attempt, later finds out it was an error
88.article_body: The family of 24-year-old Divya Pandey, who claimed she cracked civil services examination in her maiden attempt, apologised and said it was an "inadvertent error". Her family members added that it is actually one Divya P of South India who cracked the examination. Her elder sister said Divya was informed by her friend that she had secured 323rd rank.

89.title: Old tactic to disown unpopular things: Owaisi on RSS chief's 'Shivling' remark
89.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday criticised RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's Gyanvapi mosque speech, calling it "incendiary". Moreover, following Bhagwat's "Shivling" remark, Owaisi said that it's an "old Sangh tactic to disown things when they're unpopular". He also questioned "assurance" given by Bhagwat and BJP chief JP Nadda over the issue, adding that they both "hold no constitutional posts".

90.title: BMC covers over 3,600 manholes with protective nets across Mumbai
90.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon season, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has installed protective nets over 3,679 manholes across Mumbai. These nets will reportedly protect people from falling down manholes even if they are left open during flooding. "We have...appealed to residents not to remove the manhole cover in case of flooding in their areas," a BMC official said on Friday.

91.title: Not good for entrepreneurs to treat IPOs as 'surrogate' for financing: Narayana Murthy
91.article_body: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy on Friday remarked that IPOs are being treated as a "surrogate" for new rounds of financing by entrepreneurs and that this isn't a good thing. He said, "IPO comes with tremendous responsibility...so many people with very little money...put faith in us and put in their meagre disposable income, it is important to give them a...return."

92.title: India cannot just select a random team: Akhtar on T20 WC match vs Pak
92.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said India cannot just select a "random" team against Pakistan in their upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 match, without defining the roles of their players. "It won't be a walkover for Pakistan...There will be a crowd of 1,00,000 [at the MCG] out of which 70,000 will...[support] India, so the pressure will be on Pakistan," added Akhtar.

93.title: Delhi Metro to start 2 hours early on Sunday to facilitate UPSC examinees
93.article_body: Delhi Metro will begin a part of its train services two hours earlier than its scheduled time on June 5 to facilitate the candidates appearing for this year's UPSC's Civil Services (Prelim) Examination. However, this move will be applicable only in Phase-III sections which include Dilshad Garden-Shaheed Sthal, Mundka-Brigadier Hoshiar Singh and Janakpuri West-Botanical Garden, officials said.

94.title: Private news channel journalist shot at in Aligarh restaurant: Police
94.article_body: A private news channel journalist, Mukesh Gupta, was reportedly shot at by an unidentified person at a restaurant in Aligarh, police said. Another journalist who was present on the spot said, "The assailant walked up towards us...placed his pistol on Mukesh's neck and later fired towards his lower abdomen." Mukesh was rushed to hospital and is currently out of danger.

95.title: Ukrainian grain can be exported through Belarus: Putin
95.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia isn't obstructing grain export from Ukraine and western nations are trying to cover up their policy mistakes by blaming Moscow for problems in the global food market.  "If someone wants to solve the problem of exporting Ukrainian grain...the easiest way is through Belarus...But for this, you have to lift sanctions from Belarus," he added.

96.title: KK wasn't bothered about social media, he didn't even have WhatsApp: Shankar Mahadevan
96.article_body: Talking about late singer KK, Shankar Mahadevan said, "He used to talk about his family, take off on long holidays, cut off from the world." He added, "He wasn't bothered about social media...he didn’t even have WhatsApp. If you wanted to talk to him, you had to call him directly. He wasn’t worried about how many likes his songs got."

97.title: Woman protestor ties herself to the net during French Open semi-final, pics go viral
97.article_body: A woman protestor tied herself to the net during the French Open men's singles semi-final between Marin Cilic of Croatia and Norwegian Casper Ruud. The match was interrupted for 15 minutes. The woman was wearing a t-shirt that read 'We have 1028 days left' in reference to a UN report on climate change.

98.title: Mumbai reports 763 new COVID-19 cases, highest since Feb 4
98.article_body: Mumbai reported 763 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, the highest since February 4 when the figure was 846. While no new deaths were reported on Friday, the active cases in the city rose to 3,735. However, according to data published by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), the recovery rate currently stands at 98% and 95% of the positive patients are asymptomatic.

99.title: Car jumps over divider, hits truck in Pune; mother, daughter dead
99.article_body: A mother and her daughter were killed after the car they were in collided with a truck on Pune's Kiwale-Dehu road. The father lost control while driving the car, following which the vehicle jumped over the divider and came in front of the truck, according to police. The father and his son, who were in the car, are critically injured.

100.title: Marriott hotel chain to leave Russia after 25 years amid Western sanctions
100.article_body: The Marriott hotel chain has announced that it is suspending its operations in Russia after more than 25 years. The company said that the Western sanctions made it "impossible" for it to continue operations in the Russian market. In March, the company paused investment in Russia and closed its Moscow office following the invasion of Ukraine.

101.title: Edtech unicorn Eruditus fires some employees to focus on profitability
101.article_body: Mumbai-based edtech startup Eruditus has fired some of its employees from the marketing and talent acquisition teams as part of its business restructuring and to focus on profitability. While the company reportedly fired 80 employees, Co-founder Ashwin Damera said 40 of them resigned voluntarily. Eruditus turned unicorn in 2021 when it raised $650 million at a valuation of $3.2 billion.

102.title: Japan saw record low births, biggest-ever natural population drop in 2021
102.article_body: Japan, which has one of the fastest ageing populations on earth, saw record low number of births and the biggest-ever natural decline in the population in 2021, according to government data. There were 811,604 births last year, data showed. The country reported 1,439,809 deaths, leading to an overall drop of 628,205 in the population.

103.title: Boating restarts in Bengaluru's Madiwala Lake after 3 years
103.article_body: The Karnataka Forest Department has restarted boating at Bengaluru's Madiwala Lake after three years. This comes after the state department gained custody of the water body from Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. "Visitors will have to pay a nominal fee of ₹10 for entry...We've retained the rates that we'd charged in 2019," Deputy Conservator of Forests (Bengaluru Urban) SS Ravishankar said.

104.title: 39-yr-old Pune man killed as his car hits tree, catches fire in MP
104.article_body: Police said a 39-year-old man from Pune, Sunil Sindappa, was killed after his car hit a tree and caught fire in Madhya Pradesh's Betul. As the car doors were stuck, the victim got trapped inside and was burnt alive, police said. Police added some locals tried to help him, but the tyres of the car burst, which made it difficult.

105.title: BJP govt in Gujarat ashamed of its schools: Manish Sisodia
105.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and AAP leader Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP government in Gujarat and said the state government was "ashamed" of its schools. "As part of the conference (National Conference of School Education), Education Ministers from other states were supposed to see the Gujarat Model," Sisodia said. He questioned why the ministers were not shown a single government school.

106.title: 5 people arrested in RTI activist murder case in MP's Vidisha
106.article_body: Police officials said that five persons including the alleged shooter were arrested in connection with the murder of an RTI activist in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha. Ranjeet Soni, a former government contractor, was shot dead on Thursday evening. Police said that Soni allegedly used the Right to Information Act to harass other contractors, who decided to get him killed.

107.title: Our govt achieved in 8 yrs what others couldn't in 60 yrs: Thakur
107.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said the government has achieved in the past eight years what the previous government could not achieve in 60 years. "The Union Government under PM Narendra Modi has been able to sow seeds of development in the remotest corners of India," Thakur said. The gap between the rich and the poor has decreased, he added.

108.title: Hopefully, we can bring some joy to Sri Lanka: Finch ahead of Aus-SL series
108.article_body: Ahead of Sri Lanka-Australia all-format bilateral series amid Sri Lanka's worst-ever economic crisis, Australia limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch said, "Hopefully, we can bring some joy...entertainment to Sri Lanka." He added, "We're here[in Sri Lanka] to play cricket...this is the first time we're here since 2016, which is such a long gap." They'll play three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests.

109.title: Amazon consumer CEO Dave Clark resigns after 23 years at the company
109.article_body: Amazon's CEO of Worldwide Consumer Business, Dave Clark, on Friday announced that he is resigning from his position after 23 years at the company. "I've had an incredible time at Amazon but it's time for me to build again," he tweeted. Clark had joined Amazon just a day after graduating from his MBA programme, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said.

110.title: French volunteer fighter killed in Ukraine fighting Russian forces
110.article_body: A French volunteer fighter was killed in combat in Ukraine, France's Foreign Ministry said on Friday. "We remind everyone that the whole of Ukraine is a war zone. In this regard, travel to Ukraine is formally advised against, for whatever reason," it added. The French national had volunteered as a combatant to fight alongside Ukraine's military against the Russian forces.

111.title: Olympian Anjum Moudgil wins silver at ISSF Shooting World Cup 2022
111.article_body: Olympian Anjum Moudgil won a silver medal in 50m Rifle 3 Positions Women at ISSF Shooting World Cup 2022 in Baku on Friday. Anjum lost 12-16 in gold medal match against Denmark's Rikke Maeng Ibsen. In ranking match, Anjum finished second to Ibsen with a 406.5 to the Dane's 411.4. India are currently third in the standings.

112.title: Victory for Lalu ji: Tejashwi Yadav on caste-based survey in Bihar
112.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav called the approval of a caste-based survey in Bihar a victory for the former CM and his father Lalu Prasad Yadav as well as the people of Bihar. "This has been our cause from the beginning," Yadav said. The government has allocated a budget of ₹500 crore for the survey.

113.title: MLA's son not involved in gang-rape of 17-yr-old in car: Hyd Police
113.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday said an MLA's son, who was initially accused of being part of a 17-year-old girl's gang-rape, was not involved in the crime. West Zone DCP Joel Davis said three of the five culprits who were identified are minors and one of the accused has been arrested. One of the accused is a VIP's son, Davis added.

114.title: IIT Delhi student wins world's largest coding contest, gets ₹7.76 lakh
114.article_body: An IIT Delhi student has won the global coding contest, TCS CodeVita season 10, which saw the participation of 1,00,000 contestants from 87 countries. Computer Science Engineering student Kalash Gupta took home the top reward of $10,000 (around ₹7.76 lakh), a TCS press release said. CodeVita has been entitled the world's largest computer programming competition by Guinness World Records.

115.title: I get impression that India, Pak players want to play against each other regularly: Rizwan
115.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan has said that he gets the impression that India and Pakistan players want to play against each other regularly. He added, "But we can't do anything." He stated, "Everyone wants to see Pakistan and India play bilateral series or other matches but the state level affairs are not in the hands of the players."

116.title: Putin holds talks with head of African Union over grain exports
116.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and the Chairman of the African Union, Macky Sall, on Friday held talks on grain exports from Russia and Ukraine in an effort to ease a global food crisis. Russia has blockaded Ukrainian ports, disrupting the export of grains from Ukraine. Africa is heavily dependent on grain supplies from Russia and Ukraine, according to Reuters.

117.title: Trent Boult imitates Steve Smith's 'No run' impression during Lord's Test, video viral
117.article_body: A video has gone viral showing New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult imitating Australia batter Steve Smith's 'No run' impression while leaving a delivery during his team's first innings against England in the Lord's Test. "Giving Smith a tribute on his birthday," a fan tweeted. "He is putting up a show," wrote another.

118.title: India delivers 3.3 tonnes of medical supplies to Sri Lanka
118.article_body: India on Friday delivered 3.3 tonnes of medical supplies to a free pre-hospital care ambulance service in Sri Lanka amid a severe economic crisis. Notably, this comes after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar was informed of shortages faced by Suwa Seriya ambulance service during his visit to Sri Lanka in March. The service was launched in 2016 with Indian aid.

119.title: Woman gives birth to one-in-200-million identical triplets in UK, pic surfaces
119.article_body: A first-time mother from Nottingham in the UK gave birth to one-in-200-million identical triplets. Zahra Amirabadi, 28, gave birth to her daughters Roya, Adina and Sefia in December last year. The triplets are known as spontaneous identical triplets. Two of the babies, Roya and Adina, were sharing a placenta, while Sefia was on her own.

120.title: This is why sport can make you cry: Shastri on Zverev getting injured in French Open semi
120.article_body:
Reacting to world number three Alexander Zverev retiring from French Open 2022 semi-final against Rafael Nadal due to ankle injury, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "This is why sport can make you cry. You will be back 
@AlexZverev." Shastri shared a picture of Nadal walking with Zverev. He further wrote, "@RafaelNadal- Sportsmanship, humility. Just brilliant and respect."

121.title: Boarding can't be denied to disabled people without medical opinion: DGCA draft rules
121.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued draft rules for onboarding persons with disabilities/special needs after IndiGo was fined for denying boarding to a disabled child. Airlines can't deny boarding on the basis of flyers' disabilities and a decision can only be taken after consulting with a doctor, they said. DGCA has sought airlines' comments on the rules.

122.title: India should send U-23 team for SAFF Championship: Chhetri
122.article_body: India should send its Under-23 team for SAFF Championship as the country has won the football tournament for a record eighth time, said Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri. He added that younger players will get international experience and "in the worst case scenario, we're going to lose". India won SAFF title in 2009 with its Under-23 side.

123.title: Bihar boy eats 'poisoned' chocolate given by his neighbour, dies
123.article_body: A Class 7 student died after eating chocolate in a village in Bihar's Bhojpur district, police said on Friday. The victim's father accused a woman, their neighbour who runs a grocery shop, of killing his son with the poisoned chocolate. Before his death, the boy claimed he was playing with other children when he received the chocolate from the woman.

124.title: Lots of luck on trip to the Moon: Biden as Musk raises concerns about economy
124.article_body: US President Joe Biden, when asked about Tesla CEO Elon Musk's comment about having a "super bad feeling" about the economy, said, "Lots of luck on his trip to the Moon." Biden also commented on Musk's plans to cut about 10% of Tesla's workforce and said, "While Elon Musk is talking about that, Ford is increasing their investment overwhelmingly."

125.title: Maha woman kills her daughter & son for crying, burns their bodies
125.article_body: A 30-year-old woman allegedly killed her four-month-old daughter and two-year-old son for crying incessantly and later burnt their bodies at a field in a village in Maharashtra's Nanded district, police said. Police arrested the accused, along with her mother and brother, who helped her dispose the children's bodies, an officer said. The killings took place two days in a row.

126.title: Certain results achieved: Russia on day 100 of conflict in Ukraine
126.article_body: As the war in Ukraine entered its 100th day, Russian government spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that Russia has achieved some results from its military campaign. "Many settlements have been liberated from the pro-Nazi armed forces of Ukraine and directly from nationalist elements," Peskov added. Russia will achieve all the goals of its military mission in Ukraine, he further said.

127.title: Dreams do come true: Anirudh on composing 'Jawan' score for SRK
127.article_body: Music composer Anirudh Ravichander on Friday took to Twitter to pen a note on composing the music score for Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Jawan'. He wrote, "Dreams do come true! Scoring music for the Badshah himself. Thank you and so proud of my brother Atlee and this is going to be too special for us...Please bless us all."

128.title: 1 arrested for gang-rape of 17-yr-old girl in car in Hyd, 5 accused identified
128.article_body: The police on Friday said they have identified five people who allegedly gang-raped a 17-year-old girl in a Mercedes car in Hyderabad. One of the accused, identified as Saduddin Malik, has been arrested, police said. The incident had taken place on Saturday (May 28) when the girl was returning from a party. The accused reportedly belong to 'influential families'.

129.title: Nadal reaches his 14th French Open final after Zverev taken off in wheelchair over injury
129.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has reached his 14th French Open final after world number three Alexander Zverev injured his ankle and was taken off the court in a wheelchair in their semi-final. World number five Nadal had won the first set 7-6(10-8), while the second set was placed at 6-6 when Zverev retired after rolling his ankle.

130.title: Strangely not disappointed: Helly on not being invited to Cannes India Pavilion
130.article_body: Speaking about not being invited to the India Pavilion at 2022 Cannes Film Festival, actress Helly Shah said that she was strangely not disappointed. "Had I been invited I would have been very very happy and proud to represent my country," she added. Earlier, actress Hina Khan spoke about not being invited saying she was disheartened at the elitist system.

131.title: I miss him: MI bowling coach Bond on GT skipper Hardik
131.article_body: Calling Hardik Pandya a "pretty cool captain" after he led GT to IPL 2022 win in their debut season, MI bowling coach Shane Bond said he misses him. "It would've been nice to have him around in our team because he's a quality player. India need him too for...World Cup because he showed...what a good leader he is," he added.

132.title: Man found hanging in JNU campus, suspected to have died several days ago
132.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday found a highly decomposed body of a man hanging on a tree in the jungles of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). Police said that the man appears to be in his forties. The body is yet to be identified and it has been sent for post-mortem. An inquiry has been initiated, the police added.

133.title: 4 killed, 30 injured after train derails in Germany: Police
133.article_body: At least four people were killed and 30 others injured after a train derailed in Germany's Bavaria on Friday, according to the police. "We grieve with the relatives of the victims and wish all who were injured a speedy recovery," the Governor of Bavaria said. Authorities have launched an investigation into the cause of the accident.

134.title: Taliban faces threat from ISIS and new resistance: UN experts
134.article_body: Afghanistan's Taliban government faces military threats from the Islamic State (ISIS) and former Afghan government security personnel, UN experts said in a new report. Separately, the Taliban's primary concern has been to consolidate control "while seeking international recognition", the experts said. Notably, this comes amid a growing economic and humanitarian crisis in the country.

135.title: Provide security to Hindu community in J&K: Shiv Sena MP to Centre
135.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah urging him to provide adequate security to the Hindu community in Kashmir immediately. "Such targeted attacks...raise questions on the implementation of [govt] schemes...for the development and rehabilitation of Kashmiri migrants," she wrote. Chaturvedi's letter comes a day after a bank employee was shot dead in Kulgam.

136.title: Tough to say if I'll play next 5 years, not sure about 100 Tests: Umesh
136.article_body: When asked about reaching the 100-Test milestone, India pacer Umesh Yadav, who has played 52 Tests so far, said he's not sure it but he'll try to play as much as possible. "It's difficult to say whether I'll play for the next five years. I am just thinking about my small goals with each passing year," he stated.

137.title: ₹300 cr in Guj MLAs' Local Area Development funds remains unspent: ADR
137.article_body: More than ₹300 crore in the MLA Local Area Development (MLALAD) funds remains unspent in Gujarat, according to a report released by NGO Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). "The unspent amount...will expire once the Assembly term ends," it said. Of the ₹1,004 crore worth of development works, projects worth ₹677.5 crore had been completed by March this year, it claimed.

138.title: 1st pics of Moosewala's suspected killers surface, footage shows them at petrol pump
138.article_body: Days after the killing of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, images of the suspected murderers have surfaced. The suspected attackers were seen in a Bolero car in a petrol pump just hours before the murder of Moosewala. The police suspect that this is the same Bolero car that was used during the murder.

139.title: After Kashmir Files crossed ₹300cr, makers can bank on me: Darshan
139.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar stated that after 'The Kashmir Files' entered the ₹300 crore club, filmmakers who always wanted to work with him can now bank on him. The actor further said that OTT has changed the game for him and he is at the centre of things. "What I once wished...while joining the industry, I'm getting to live," he added.

140.title: Wanted to make horror film even kids can enjoy: 'Bhool...' director
140.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee has said that he wanted to make a horror film that even children could enjoy without getting scared. The director further said that he realised with 2007 film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' that kids feared Manjulika but also got "kind of excited". 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' beat 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' to become 2022's biggest Hindi box office opener.

141.title: Man arrested with illegal arms & ammunition in West Bengal's Malda
141.article_body: Police said that a man was arrested with illegal arms and ammunition by the Special Task Force in West Bengal's Malda district. Three 7 mm pistols, six magazines and 18 rounds of bullets were recovered from him, police added. An investigation is underway to find from where he procured the arms and ammunition, they said.

142.title: Regulatory waiting period for Musk's $44 billion buyout deal is over: Twitter
142.article_body: Twitter on Friday said that the waiting period under the HSR Act for billionaire Elon Musk's $44-billion acquisition deal has expired. The deal's completion is now subject to remaining customary closing conditions, which include approval by Twitter stockholders and receipt of required regulatory approvals, Twitter said. The deal has cleared an antitrust review by the Federal Trade Commission.

143.title: BJP protests at Hyderabad police station as minor girl gangraped in car
143.article_body: BJP workers on Friday held a protest at the Jubilee Hills police station in Hyderabad. Security forces have been deployed at the site of the protest, which came after a 17-year-old girl returning from a birthday party was allegedly gangraped in a Mercedes car by five juveniles in Hyderabad. The protesting BJP workers were purportedly heard saying, "We want justice."

144.title: Many countries send back Indian tea over high pesticide content
144.article_body: Both international and domestic buyers have rejected a series of tea consignments due to presence of pesticides and chemicals beyond permissible limits, Indian Tea Exporters Association Chairman Anshuman Kanoria said. Kanoria added many countries are following strict entry regulations for tea. Most of the countries follow variations of EU standards, which are more stringent than FSSAI rules.

145.title: I've no doubt that Nadal's foot will last till the end of French Open: Moya
145.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal's chronic foot injury issues, his coach Carlos Moya said the 13-time champion's foot will undoubtedly last until the end of the ongoing French Open. "He will need it to beat Alexander Zverev [in semi-final], who is a great champion," he added. Nadal took four hours 12 minutes to beat defending champion Novak Djokovic in the quarter-final.

146.title: Harvey Weinstein's sex crimes conviction upheld by New York Court
146.article_body: A New York appeals court has upheld former Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein's sex crimes conviction. The 70-year-old was appealing his February 2020 conviction and 23-year prison sentence for assaulting former production assistant Mimi Haleyi and raping former aspiring actress Jessica Mann. In a statement, Weinstein's spokesperson said that his legal team was "disappointed but not surprised."

147.title: Centre taking strict action against terrorism in J&K: Himachal CM
147.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur condemned the killings in Jammu and Kashmir and said that the Centre is taking strict action against terrorism in the valley. "It's very unfortunate. We last witnessed targeted killings (in Jammu and Kashmir) in 1989-1990," Thakur said. Now the terrorists think that "a particular community may return" so they're targeting them again, he added.

148.title: KK didn't want to come out of car after seeing too much crowd at venue, claims singer
148.article_body: Singer Subhalakhmi Dey, who performed at the Nazrul Mancha auditorium on May 31 before KK's concert, said KK saw the crowd outside the auditorium and he didn't want to get out of his car at first. "There was too much crowd outside...the auditorium at the time KK arrived. KK arrived at 5:30 pm," she told India Today.

149.title: Journalist shot at while having dinner at Uttar Pradesh restaurant
149.article_body: A journalist was shot at by an unidentified assailant while having dinner inside a restaurant in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh, police said. The Chief Medical Officer (CMO) said the patient is out of danger as the bullet missed his vital organs. The accused had allegedly chased three other journalists present at the spot, but they managed to escape and inform police.

150.title: Makers believe I can do heavy roles after 'Chhorii': Nushrratt
150.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has stated that filmmakers believe she can do heavy roles after 'Chhorii' and 'Ajeeb Daastaans'. "There are some producers who have said, 'We can only think of you,' which is great. It has a lot to do with the body of work," the actress added. She further said that she was offered three women-led movies after 'Chhorii'.

151.title: I'm in favour of a strong opposition in country: PM Modi
151.article_body: Addressing an event at President Ram Nath Kovind's ancestral Paraunkh village in UP, PM Narendra Modi said that he is in favour of a strong opposition. Dynastic politics is throttling talent in the country, he added. Dynastic politics must stop so that anyone born in a village can become the PM and the President, he further said.

152.title: Govt approves 8.1% interest rate on EPF deposits for FY22, lowest in 4 decades
152.article_body: The central government has approved an interest rate of 8.1% on employee provident fund (EPF) deposits for 2021-22, news agency PTI reported citing an office order from the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). In March, the EPFO had lowered the rate to 8.1% from 8.5% in the previous year, marking the lowest EPF interest rate in more than 40 years.

153.title: It was a nightmare to face Wasim Akram: Jayawardena
153.article_body: On being asked the toughest bowler he has ever faced, ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said, "Hands down, Wasim Akram." He added. "I made my debut when he [Akram] was at his peak or...backend of his career...was a nightmare to face him as it was tough." Jayawardena made his international debut for Sri Lanka in 1997.

154.title: PMC to spend ₹170 crore for expansion of 24x7 water supply project
154.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that expansion of the 24x7 water supply project would cost around ₹170 crore. The project will have water supply infrastructure for 34 villages merged into the city civic limits. In the first phase of the project, work will be done in Bavdhan, Sus and Mhalunge.

155.title: Moosewala killed for revenge, I had no role in murder: Lawrence Bishnoi to police
155.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, while being interrogated by the Delhi Police, denied a role in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, reports said on Friday. Bishnoi, however, told police that Moosewala was killed for revenge, reports added. Bishnoi and his aide Goldy Brar are among the prime suspects in the killing of Moosewala who was shot dead on Sunday (May 29).

156.title: Woman in US gets 3D-printed ear made from her cells in world-first transplant
156.article_body: A 20-year-old woman in US, who was born with a small and misshapen right ear, successfully received a 3D-printed ear implant made from her own cells. This is believed to be the first known example of a 3D-printed implant made of living tissues. The new ear will continue to regenerate cartilage tissue, giving it the appearance of a natural ear.

157.title: Bengaluru-based startup joins NASA's PACE mission
157.article_body: Bengaluru-based environment intelligence startup Ambee said that it will join NASA's PACE (Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem) mission. The mission aims to extend and improve satellite observations of global ocean biology, aerosols and clouds. "This collaboration with NASA and PACE scientists will allow us to develop in-depth solutions," Madhusudhan Anand, CTO and Co-founder of Ambee, said.

158.title: Visually-impaired woman seeking help to cross road in Delhi raped
158.article_body: A 24-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old visually-impaired woman near Sitapuri bus stand in Delhi's Dwarka. "When she asked locals to help her in crossing a road, the accused took her to a deserted lane and raped her," Dwarka DCP Shankar Choudhary said. Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal also met the survivor.

159.title: So proud: Ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama to Gauff on reaching 1st Slam final
159.article_body: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama took to Twitter to congratulate Coco Gauff after the 18-year-old American reached her maiden Grand Slam final at French Open on Thursday. "I'm so proud of you and I will be rooting for you all the way!" she wrote. The 18th seed defeated unseeded Martina Trevisan of Italy 6-3, 6-1 in the semi-final.

160.title: Stone-pelting in UP over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet, 17 held
160.article_body: Two groups clashed in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday over a call to shut down markets following recent controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. At least 17 persons have been detained following the incident, which also involved stone-pelting. As per reports, police used tear gas shells and resorted to lathicharge to bring the situation under control.

161.title: Pre-monsoon works completed in Mumbai, ready for rain: BMC
161.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that it is fully prepared for the upcoming monsoon and said all pre-monsoon works including desilting of stormwater drains and trimming of trees have been completed in Mumbai. BMC also added that the situation would be reviewed periodically. This year, two additional NDRF teams will be deployed in areas which are prone to landslides.

162.title: Akshay wanted to reclaim history with 'Samrat Prithviraj': Director
162.article_body: 'Samrat Prithviraj' director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi has stated that actor Akshay Kumar wanted to "reclaim our history" with the film. He added, "Akshay spoke to me and said, 'I'm ready to do the film...The current narrative of history is such where a section of people in India don't feel proud. Can we reclaim our history?' Soon, everything fell into place."

163.title: Centre writes to 5 states over rise in COVID-19 cases, issues advisory
163.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Health Secretaries of five states that have reported a rise in COVID-19 cases recently. He advised governments of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Telangana, Maharashtra and Karnataka to "maintain strict watch and take pre-emptive action" to control COVID-19 spread. The states have been told to ensure adequate testing, send samples for genome sequencing etc.

164.title: Jaffer shares Salman's meme to troll Lord's pitch after 17 wickets fall in 1 day
164.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled Lord's pitch and took a dig at people who criticise Indian pitches, after 17 wickets fell on Day 1 of England-New Zealand Test. "When 17 wickets fall in a day at Lord's...talk is about skills of...bowlers. When 17 wickets fall in a day at Ahmedabad...talk is about conditions," Jaffer wrote, sharing a Salman Khan meme.

165.title: Rachakonda Police arrest drug peddler, drugs worth ₹30 lakh seized
165.article_body: The Rachakonda Special Operations Team along with the Meerpet Police busted an interstate drug syndicate and seized drugs worth ₹30.29 lakh. Police said that they arrested Parasmal alias Paras Seervi and seized 1 kg of opium, 5.2 kg of poppy straw, 2 kg of poppy straw powder and other materials. Another suspect named Deepak is absconding, the police said.

166.title: Mumbai taxi drivers unfairly targeted over minor offences: Union
166.article_body: General Secretary of Mumbai Taximen's Union AL Quadros criticised Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey and alleged that taxi drivers were 'unfairly targeted over minor traffic offences'. He further claimed that the police made matters worse for drivers by registering offences for honking. Drivers whose daily income is less than ₹300 cannot afford to pay such fines, Quadros added.

167.title: GHMC Mayor launches phase 4 of 'Pattana Pragathi programme' in Hyd
167.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said the fourth phase of 'Pattana Pragathi programme' was launched at NBT Nagar Banjara Hills division. This programme focuses on urban sanitation by desilting all drains, solid waste management and removal of construction and demolition debris, Gadwal added. The programme will be conducted from June 3 to June 15.

168.title: Nearly 60 kg expired meat seized during raid at Chennai restaurant
168.article_body: Tamil Nadu Food Safety Department officials have found nearly 60 kilograms of expired meat, including chicken and fish, after raiding a restaurant on Chennai's 100 Feet Road. The raid was conducted following a customer's complaint. Officials said the meat was stored in a damaged freezer box and the restaurant has been asked to shut down its kitchen for 15 days.

169.title: Happy 13 years to me & my dear 'Pavitra Rishta': Ankita Lokhande
169.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande shared pictures on social media to celebrate 13 years in the television industry and her show 'Pavitra Rishta'. "[Thank you] everyone for making this day so memorable. I loved each and every edit u guys have made...I love each and every one and so grateful for all the love [you] give," the actress wrote.

170.title: Police arrest girl & 2 friends for trying to snatch chain in B'luru
170.article_body: A girl student and two of her friends were arrested in Bengaluru for attempting to snatch a gold chain from an elderly woman, the police said. The girl had approached the elderly woman on the pretext of giving her a pamphlet. The police also said that the accused had tried to steal the chain to repay a loan of ₹5,000.

171.title: Amit Shah holds high-level security meeting over killings in J&K
171.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday held a high-level security meeting over the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. The meeting was attended by National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Army Chief General Manoj Pande, among others. At least three civilians and two security personnel were killed in the Union Territory last month.

172.title: Europe believes its problems are world's problems, world's issues aren't Europe's: EAM
172.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar while speaking at a GLOBESEC discussion, said, "Europe has to get out of the mindset that Europe's problems are the world's problems but the world's problems are not Europe's problems." He said this in response to a question comparing the India-China conflict with the Russia-Ukraine war and India's stance on the Ukraine war.

173.title: We should save Kashmiri Pandits: Kangana on violence in J&K
173.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday took to Instagram Stories to react to the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir which were claimed by Lashkar-e-Taiba terror group's outfit The Resistance Front. Sharing a screenshot of a news article, she wrote, "We should save Kashmiri Pandits." Reportedly, nine people have been victims of targetted killings in the union territory since May 1.

174.title: People left hanging upside down as ride gets stuck at amusement park in US
