348.title: Police constable kills self with AK-47 at Punjab AAP MLA's house
348.article_body: A policeman deployed for the security of Punjab AAP MLA Sheetal Angural shot himself dead with an AK-47 rifle on the premises of the legislator's residence in Jalandhar on Thursday. Pawan Kumar, 29, had joined back work on Thursday after a leave of seven days. The constable had recently been married.

349.title: Haryana Congress MLAs taken to Chhattisgarh resort amid poaching fears
349.article_body: Haryana Congress on Thursday shifted its MLAs to a resort in Naya Raipur, Chhattisgarh amid fears of poaching ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls. Buses carrying the MLAs were seen arriving at the Mayfair resort amid heavy police deployment. Party MP Deepender Singh Hooda had earlier said, "No MLA is upset...All MLAs will go to Chhattisgarh."

350.title: 22-year-old singer Sheil Sagar from Delhi passes away due to unknown causes
350.article_body: Sheil Sagar, a 22-year-old Delhi-based musician and singer died due to unknown causes. The news of his death was confirmed on social media by his friends and musicians in Delhi. According to a Rolling Stones report, Sheil played the piano, guitar and saxophone and rose to prominence with his acoustic debut single 'If I Tried' last year.

351.title: Imran Khan granted pre-arrest bail in Azadi March cases till June 25
351.article_body: A Pakistani court has granted ex-PM Imran Khan pre-arrest bail till June 25 in cases related to violence that erupted during his Azadi March last month. The Peshawar HC granted bail to Khan, against whom 14 cases have been registered on charges that he incited violence, on surety of PKR 50,000. Khan had organised rally to demand expedited general elections.

352.title: Those who'll watch Samrat Prithviraj tomorrow; don't give spoilers: Akshay
352.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar on Thursday shared a note for his fans and followers ahead of the release of his film 'Samrat Prithviraj'. Taking to Instagram, Akshay wrote, "This is our sincere request to everyone watching the film from tomorrow, to not give out spoilers that reveal several aspects of our film that are designed to be awe-inspiring."

353.title: Mumbai sees 704 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 7.37%
353.article_body: Mumbai reported 704 new cases of COVID-19 on Thursday as compared to 739 cases recorded the previous day. The positivity rate stood at 7.37%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases rose to 3,324. On Wednesday, the city reported the highest daily rise in cases after February 4 and the active cases were reported at 2,970.

354.title: Huge explosion, fire at a chemical factory in Gujarat's Vadodara; pics surface
354.article_body: Huge explosion and fire have been reported at Deepak Nitrite Company's plant located at Nandesari Gujarat Industrial Development Corporation (GIDC) in Vadodara. Fire tenders have been rushed to the spot as 10 people have reportedly been hurt and many are feared trapped. The Vadodara Highway has been closed off due to the fire.

355.title: I had a weak govt, was blackmailed from everywhere as we didn't have power: Imran Khan
355.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan has said that he had a weak government. "Our hands were tied. We were blackmailed from everywhere. Power wasn't with us. Everyone knows where the power lies in Pakistan so we had to rely on them," he stated. Khan was replaced by PML-N's Shehbaz Sharif as Pakistan PM.

356.title: Pollard tweets 'Hope followers increased' to his critic Aakash Chopra, deletes it later
356.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard took to Twitter to take a dig at Aakash Chopra, who had criticised his performance in IPL 2022 and had said, "I think we have seen the last of Pollard." Pollard, in a now-deleted tweet, wrote, "Hope the fan base and followers increased @cricketaakash...keep it flowing!"

357.title: Over 1 million people are displaced in Myanmar: UN report
357.article_body: The number of people displaced within Myanmar has exceeded 1 million for the first time, UN's new report has stated. The figure includes almost 7 lakh people displaced by violence and insecurity since military seized power in a coup last year, the report claimed. "The impact on civilians is worsening daily with frequent...attacks...involving explosive hazards, including landmines," report read.

358.title: Alia Bhatt's performance in Gangubai Kathiawadi was superb: Kartik
358.article_body: When asked about the last time an actor's performance humbled him, actor Kartik Aaryan said, "I can't think of just one. There are so many great actors in our industry and so many of my contemporaries have been giving some amazing performances." "Alia Bhatt's [performance] in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'...was just superb, and so many more," Kartik said.

359.title: Levying service charge is illegal, end practice immediately: Govt to restaurants
359.article_body: The Centre on Thursday told the National Restaurant Association of India that the service charge levied by restaurants on consumers is illegal and asked the restaurants to end the practice immediately, PTI reported. The government stated that it will soon come up with a "robust framework to ensure strict compliance by the stakeholders" as the issue adversely affects consumers daily.

360.title: 4 Indians killed in Tara Air flight crash cremated at Nepal temple
360.article_body: The bodies of four Indians, who were among 22 people killed in Tara Air flight crash on May 29, were cremated at Kathmandu's Pashupatinath temple on Thursday. The deceased, Ashok Kumar Tripathi and his estranged wife Vaibhavi, were onboard the flight with their children as the family was on a court-ordered holiday. Ashok's relatives were present for the last rites.

361.title: Who is Camille Vasquez, Johnny Depp's lawyer in defamation trial against Amber Heard?
361.article_body: Camille Vasquez, Johnny Depp's lawyer in his defamation trial against Amber Heard, hails from Los Angeles, California. She attended the University of Southern California and Southwestern Law School. Camille started working with Brown Rudnick LLP as an associate attorney in 2018. "Her current practice focuses on plaintiff-side defamation suits," the firm's website reads.

362.title: Kashmiri Pandits hold protests in J&K, threaten mass migration over targeted killings
362.article_body: Kashmiri Pandits, including the employees who were given jobs under a PM's package for the community, held protests and threatened mass migration after targeted killings in J&K. Many of them have left the valley, according to reports. A 26-year-old bank manager from Rajasthan was shot dead inside the bank by a terrorist on Thursday.

363.title: Lost appendix not sense of humour: Nakuul shares health update post surgery
363.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Nakuul Mehta shared his health update with his fans post his surgery and wrote, "We went from celebration to hospitalisation in a span of 24 hours...I'm overwhelmed with...the messages...It may take me a few days to get to them whilst I regain my strength...However...the good news is that we've...lost our appendix...not our sense of humour!"

364.title: Don't dare to cross limits: Pak PM to Khan on 'breaking Pak' remark
364.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday warned his predecessor Imran Khan against making "naked threats" about the country's division, adding that Khan shouldn't "dare to cross limits". Sharif's remark came in response to Khan's comment that Pakistan may break into three parts if government doesn't make right decisions. He had also said that Pakistan could lose its nuclear deterrent capabilities.

365.title: ExpressVPN removes VPN services in India as refusal to comply with govt order
365.article_body: ExpressVPN on Thursday announced it has removed its virtual private network (VPN) servers in India. This is in response to a recent data law introduced in India requiring VPN providers to store user information for at least five years. "Our users will still be able to connect to VPN servers that will give them Indian IP addresses," said ExpressVPN.

366.title: CBI files charge sheet against Anil Deshmukh in ₹100-cr bribery case
366.article_body: The CBI has filed a charge sheet against former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh and others in a ₹100-crore bribery case, officials said. This comes after a special CBI court allowed dismissed Mumbai Police officer Sachin Vaze to turn an approver and seek pardon in the case. Deshmukh and his two staffers were arrested by the CBI in April.

367.title: Preity shares old pic from her school days, says 'It made me feel so grown up'
367.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta on Thursday shared a throwback picture of hers with her friend and her mother. Sharing the photo, she wrote, "I remember taking this photo after passing out of school. I was...excited to be in college even though I was still in 11th grade. Made me feel so grown up. Love this photo @shagunkhanna. Miss you, Paddy aunty."

368.title: Caste-based census in Bihar to be completed by Feb 2023, state to spend ₹500 cr
368.article_body: The Bihar Cabinet has decided to complete the caste-based census in the state by February next year. The government will spend ₹500 crore on it from the contingency fund, the cabinet has decided. On Wednesday, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that a caste-based count will be held in the state by a set deadline.

369.title: Kiya.ai launches Kiyaverse, India's first banking metaverse
369.article_body: Kiya.ai has announced the launch of India's first-ever banking metaverse named Kiyaverse. Kiyaverse hopes to merge use cases of real-world banking with metaverse banking through avatar-based interactions. Kiya.ai MD and CEO Rajesh Mirjankar said the firm's product roadmap includes integration with Central Bank Digital Currency and interoperability with other metaverses to enable open finance.

370.title: CBDCs would kill case for private cryptos' existence: RBI Deputy Guv
370.article_body: Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) would "actually...kill whatever little case there could be for private cryptocurrencies", said RBI Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar on Thursday. Sankar also reiterated RBI's view that private cryptocurrencies shouldn't be permitted "just because they're backed by hi-tech". "Any tool that can be used for good can also be put to undesirable uses," he added.

371.title: He married 4 months ago, didn't even get his wedding album: Father of bank manager killed in J&K
371.article_body: After 26-year-old bank manager Vijay Kumar Beniwal from Rajasthan was shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam, his father said Vijay got married nearly four months ago and "even his wedding photo album wasn't ready yet." "He got married on February 10 and left for a job after 10 days. He recently took his wife with him," his father added.

372.title: Singers don't have power, they need godfather: Indian Idol winner Abhijeet
372.article_body: Indian Idol winner Abhijeet Sawant in an interview said his career didn't turn out the way he hoped because he has always been burdened with the tag of being a reality show winner. "The playback industry offers...lot of opportunities but at the same time, you need...a godfather," he added. "In this industry, singers don’t have much power," Abhijeet said.

373.title: 3 men arrested with 23 kg marijuana in separate cases in Pune
373.article_body: Three people were arrested and around 23 kg of marijuana was seized along with sharp weapons in separate incidents in Pune. In the first case, police seized around 21 kg of marijuana worth over ₹4.2 lakh from a 32-year-old man in Hingne. In the second case, two accused were arrested with 1.6 kg of marijuana.

374.title: Pic shows Johnny Depp's legal team hugging each other after he wins defamation trial
374.article_body: Johnny Depp's legal team celebrated inside a Virginia courtroom immediately after a jury ruled in favour of the actor's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard. Visuals from the court showed several attorneys on Depp's team smiling and group-hugging after the verdict was read. Depp was not in the courtroom to hear the verdict in his defamation case against Heard.

375.title: Pod hotel services likely to open at Mumbai's CSMT this month
375.article_body: A pod hotel, also known as a capsule hotel, is being developed at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) and is likely to be opened for public this month, Central Railway officials said. This pod hotel will have a capacity of 50 persons, the officials added. In November 2021, a pod hotel was opened at the Mumbai Central railway station.

376.title: Highly condemnable: Rajasthan CM on bank manager's killing in J&K
376.article_body: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot condemned the killing of a Rajasthan resident in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district and called the incident "highly condemnable". "I pray to God to give peace to his soul and courage to his family," Gehlot tweeted. Vijay Kumar, a bank manager from Rajasthan, was shot dead by terrorists in Kulgam inside the bank premises.

377.title: Those who should protect Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting film: Rahul
377.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said those who should be protecting Kashmiri Pandits are busy promoting a film (The Kashmir Files). Referring to the targeted killings in Kashmir, Gandhi said, "Bank manager, teacher and many other innocent people are being killed everyday, Kashmiri Pandits are fleeing." "Take immediate steps to restore peace in Kashmir, Prime Minister ji," he added.

378.title: 20 'mini-forests' to be built in Ghaziabad by the end of 2022
378.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation is planning to create 20 'mini-forests' across the city by the end of this year to improve the greenery and forest cover, officials said. Officials added that four other plantation sites which were developed as a pilot project, showed a plant survival rate of about 95%. The plantation drive at these sites was initiated in 2021.

379.title: 45-yr-old Noida man arrested for assaulting his 70-yr-old mother
379.article_body: Police said that they arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly assaulting his 70-year-old mother at their house in Noida. The accused, Manoj, got into a fight with his mother Jagvati Devi on May 28, after which he assaulted her with a stick and other heavy objects, police added. A video of the woman's injuries was shared on social media platforms.

380.title: US, NZ smeared our cooperation with Pacific countries: China
380.article_body: China on Wednesday accused the US and New Zealand of "smearing" its cooperation with Pacific nations. China's reaction comes in response to a joint statement by US President Joe Biden and New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern, expressing concern about possible Chinese military presence in the Pacific. Notably, 10 Pacific countries recently refused to sign trade and security deal with China.

381.title: Man gets life term for killing his factory owner's wife in Thane
381.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Manoranjan Mahakand, was sentenced to life imprisonment by a court in Maharashtra's Thane for killing his factory owner's wife in 2016. Additional public prosecutor told the court that Mahakand visited his factory owner's house often and fell in love with his wife. During such visit, he suspected her of being in love with someone and killed her.

382.title: Hyd student kills self allegedly after being harassed by TRS corporator
382.article_body: A B.Tech student in Hyderabad allegedly died by suicide after hanging himself from the ceiling in his house on Thursday. The family of the victim, Sharath, has alleged that he killed himself over harassment by a Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) corporator. Reportedly, the corporator attacked the student over a civil dispute two days ago.

383.title: Modi government is behaving worse than Congress: AIADMK
383.article_body: The All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) organisational secretary C Ponnaiyan criticised its ally BJP saying PM Narendra Modi-led government at the Centre is behaving worse than Congress. Calling BJP anti-Tamil, Ponnaiyan said, "Tamil Nadu should be given an exemption in language policy." He further alleged that the BJP is continuously "imposing" Hindi despite AIADMK's opposition.

384.title: Heatwave warning issued for 6 states; IMD releases list
384.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heatwave conditions in isolated pockets of Rajasthan on June 3. The IMD also said that heatwave condition is likely over south Punjab, south Haryana, south Uttar Pradesh and north Madhya Pradesh on June 3 and 4 and over Maharashtra till June 5. Rainfall has been predicted in several states on Thursday.

385.title: Hrithik's cousin Pashmina Roshan to make her B'wood debut with Ishq Vishk sequel
385.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's cousin Pashmina Roshan will make her acting debut with Shahid's 'Ishq Vishk' sequel, along with Rohit Saraf, Jibraan Khan, and Naila Grewal. Sharing the video announcement on Instagram, Pashmina wrote, "I'm extremely excited...to bring to you my first experience on screen." Congratulating Pashmina, her uncle, filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, commented, "Congratulations to all."

386.title: Monsoon enters northeast, heavy rains likely in Assam, Meghalaya: IMD
386.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday said southwest monsoon has entered northeast India and is set to bring heavy rains over Assam and Meghalaya over next two days. IMD has forecast fairly widespread rainfall over coastal and south interior Karnataka, Kerala, Mahe and Lakshadweep over next five days. Heatwave warnings have been issued over Rajasthan, south Punjab and south Haryana.

387.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Bhajan Sopori passes away aged 73 due to cancer
387.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Bhajan Sopori passed away on Thursday aged 73. "He was suffering from colon cancer. He...would have celebrated his 74th birthday on June 22," his son Abhay Sopori stated. He added that his father passed away at 3:30 pm and was "ailing in the hospital for the last three weeks".

388.title: You cannot belittle any language: Kamal Haasan on national language debate
388.article_body: Sharing that language is a part of a person's culture and community, actor Kamal Haasan said, "A language is far more ingrained in a person, it's part of his culture. It's bigger than community sometimes. You cannot belittle any language." "I'm...proud (of our national anthem) but I don't question why the national anthem isn't there in my language," he added.

389.title: Gerard  Piqué caught cheating by Shakira, couple set to separate: Report
389.article_body: Singer Shakira and footballer Gerard  Piqué are on the verge of splitting up after she caught him cheating with another woman a few weeks back, said reports. As per a report in El Periodico, Piqué moved out from the house he shares with Shakira and has been living alone in Barcelona. The report claimed that Piqué lives a "party lifestyle".

390.title: Russia occupies 20% of Ukraine's territory: Zelenskyy
390.article_body: Russia now occupies about 20% of Ukraine's territory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said while addressing Luxembourg's Parliament on Thursday. The front lines of battle are stretched across over 1,000 kilometres, he added. "We have to defend ourselves against almost the entire Russian army. All combat-ready Russian military formations are involved in this aggression," he further said.

391.title: After UP, Madhya Pradesh makes Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' tax-free
391.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday announced that 'Samrat Prithviraj', featuring actor Akshay Kumar and actress Manushi Chhillar, will be made tax-free in the state. 
Chouhan said the decision was taken so that more people watch the movie. Earlier in the day, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath declared the movie tax-free.

392.title: Bank manager Vijay 8th victim of targeted killings in J&K since May 1
392.article_body: Vijay Kumar, a bank manager who was shot dead by a terrorist in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam on Thursday, is eighth victim of targeted killings in Kashmir since May 1. On May 31, a female teacher was shot dead at a school in Kulgam. A man was killed after terrorists attacked a newly-opened wine shop in Baramulla on May 17.

393.title: UN approves request to change Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye'
393.article_body: UN on Wednesday approved Turkey's request to change its official name to 'Türkiye', Stephane Dujarric, spokesman for UN chief Antonio Guterres said. Dujarric stated the name change became effective after UN received Turkish government's letter requesting use of 'Türkiye' for all affairs. "Türkiye is the best representation...of...[our]...culture," President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan had earlier said.

394.title: He's had a disgusting year at every level: Jerome Rothen on Messi
394.article_body: Ex-PSG player Jerome Rothen said PSG forward Lionel Messi has had a disgusting year at every level. "If you can't run, don't come to the field...On the field, you're judged as a 100 [percent] player," added Rothen. "The concern for adaptation can happen to all players. But we are talking about the best player on the football planet," stated Rothen.

395.title: Rather good news: Real Madrid's Hazard on Mbappé not joining Madrid
395.article_body: Real Madrid forward Eden Hazard said Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappé's decision to extend his contract with PSG rather than signing for Madrid is "good" news. "Competition for places is already tough at Real but with...Mbappé they would have become even more tough," added Hazard. Real Madrid president Florentino Perez earlier said that Mbappé has "already been forgotten".

396.title: 10-yr-old boy bitten by snake in Kerala school on 2nd day of reopening
396.article_body: A 10-year-old boy was bitten by a snake inside the premises of a government school in Kerala's Thrissur district. The incident occurred on Thursday, a day after schools in the state reopened for the new academic year. The child was reportedly bitten by a viper after alighting from the school bus. He was rushed to a government hospital, reports added.

397.title: Wish you a speedy recovery: PM Modi to Sonia Gandhi after she tests COVID-19 positive
397.article_body: After Congress announced that the party's interim President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Wishing Congress President Smt Sonia Gandhi Ji a speedy recovery from COVID-19." Congress said that she developed mild symptoms and has isolated herself, adding, "As of today, her date of appearance before Enforcement Directorate on June 8 stands as it is."

398.title: Western viewers tweet RRR is a gay movie, Ram Gopal Varma says 'I was right'
398.article_body: After several viewers from West took to Twitter to say that 'RRR' is a gay movie, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma tweeted, saying, "I was right." Varma attached a news report about people calling the movie gay with his tweet. "Jaw-dropping action, yes...Adventure, yes...Revenge, yes...But why did none of you tell me RRR movie was so heartwarmingly gay??" a viewer wrote.

399.title: Delhivery shares surge 15%, touch their highest-ever price of ₹617
399.article_body: Shares of Delhivery rose to their highest-ever price of ₹617.35/share on Thursday after Credit Suisse initiated coverage with an 'outperform' rating. Shares of Delhivery, which were listed on May 24, were up ₹81.7, or 15%, compared with its closing price of ₹535.65 recorded on Wednesday. The shares have risen 26.7% from their IPO issue price of ₹487/share.

400.title: Mobile app developed to alert people about lightning, give trigger warnings
400.article_body: Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM-Pune) and Earth System Science Organisation (ESSO) under Ministry of Earth Sciences have developed Damini mobile application to alert people about lightning. Reports said the app alerts users about lightning near them by GPS notification under 20 km and 40 km and also gives trigger warnings about lightning strikes one or two hours in advance.

401.title: Who is 44-year-old Javier Olivan, Meta's next COO?
401.article_body: Javier Olivan, who is replacing Sheryl Sandberg as Meta's next COO, has been working with the company since October 2007. Olivan, who hails from Spain, did his electrical and industrial engineering from University of Navarra and MBA from Stanford University. Before joining Facebook in late 2007 as head of international growth, the 44-year-old worked at Japan's NTT and Siemens.
